medical_history.chief_complaint: 2 days of epigastric pain radiating to the back, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presented with symptoms 2 days prior to hospital admission, with intensity noted as significant due to reported discomfort. Symptoms included epigastric pain radiating to the back, nausea, and vomiting. No specific aggravating or relieving factors are mentioned.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus (IDDM), chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), hypertension (HTN), hyperlipidemia, peripheral artery disease (PAD) with arterial insufficiency and vascular claudication of the left lower extremity; has undergone 3 vascular procedures ( catheterizations for revascularization) including 1 stent placed a couple years ago, chronic decreased sensation in left foot, erectile dysfunction not responsive to Viagra.
medical_history.family_history: Mother and father both deceased from colon cancer. Siblings are all deceased; oldest sister died of myocardial infarction, another sister died from a brain tumor, and a brother died following a back operation.
